comment: Mr. Thompson is an unclear grader and doesn't give you much of a syllabus to use while writing a paper for him or completing some of his assignments. 1 big paper, 1 midterm test, and about 8 mini homework assignments. He also requires you to attend convocation, which only takes about 45 minutes but it is on a Friday evening.

Don't do it. He's a great guy but I hated his class. He was funny and a great story teller but he's such a hard grader. Never had any quizzes or tests other than the midterm. The final was a really hard paper about how the movie cars shows the transition between high school to college with at least 10 scholarly sources. Don't do it.

This was my harder class of the semester. Very tough grader. He misses class a lot though due to being out of town. Assignments are very hard, but very stupid. He made us write a paper about the movie Cars and we had to have 10 scholarly sources. WTH??? He takes this class very seriously, so if you're looking for an easy class, this is not it.

Dr. Thompson is a very good professor who cares about you and your grades. You only have 2 test (midterm and final) and we haven't had any quizzes yet. Dr. Thompson is also very funny and very laid back. He is my favorite professor for sure this semester. Recommend taking him!

He's a really good teacher but he definitely wants his students to work hard for their grade.  He's a really nice guy but gets off track a lot when he's giving lectures.  His test was open-note but really really long and a lot of people struggled.  You have to give a speech and write a couple papers.  Work load was a little annoying.

Seemed like a nice guy but when he lectured he rambled a lot and got way off topic. We had a presentation and barely anybody passed and if they did it was a low grade. Gets random test questions out of textbook that are very vague. For a "transition into college class" as other teachers who teach that class call it, it was very difficult.

He's really not that bad. All he wants is to see his students trying. If you show an effort (go to his office, use the writing center) then you will ace all the important stuff. Quizzes can be hard, but if you do well on the final and your final paper then you'll be fine.

Seriously the worst professor ever. His class was my absolute hardest. I'm an all A student, but struggled for a C in his class. He constantly talks about himself and relates all of his assignments about himself. You have to know the most pointless things for quizzes that are overlooked. DON'T TAKE.
Very nice man, if you need help he is more than happy yo help you.

Well this class made my transition into college extremely difficult because I was stressed the whole time during this class. This teacher literally assigned work on work and provided barely any time for us to complete it. The quizzes were extremely hard and they weren't even about the topics of the chapters. DO NOT TAKE HIM
Nice guy, but in order to do well in his class you must take all outside assignments very seriously. He requires a lot of campus involvement....

I only went to this class for one day and have already dropped it because of his attitude. He was rude and thought he was a lot funnier than he actually was. He spent a lot of class telling us about himself and made us ask questions about him. I already know that I'm not going to be able to stay in this class with this man.

Such a nice professor, but NOT an easy A. You really have to work hard to get a good grade. You will have a lot of assignments and quizzes to do. He is very helpful and always wants to make sure that you understood what he is teaching. VERY funny person and really cares about his students. I recommend him, but be willing to put effort on it.

This first year seminar is nothing but STRESS. He expects A LOT out of his students. You will have multiple assignments at once. Class starts off with easy homework grades and ends up being very stressful. With that being said, he is a nice man and always willing to work with you. Must put forth a great amount of effort if you even want a low B.

If you're looking for an easy A, don't take Thompson. It's not impossible to get an A but you'll have to earn it. Although his class may seem irrelevant at times and you get a bunch of busy work, he really works hard to get his students to succeed. He's always available to talk to him his office and is really helpful if you take the time to see him

Ridiculous class and teacher. No one informed us we would be taking a course in NASCAR when we registered. Tries to connect that brainless activity to intellectual pursuits. Gives more assignments than my friends have in 3000 and 4000 level courses. Take anybody else!
HORRIBLE teacher! He's an easy grader at first, but when the heavier weighted assignments come up- he grades them HARD. There's a lot of busy work and unnecessary reading. Wouldn't recommend him.

Worst teacher I have ever had. Assignments are useless and more complicated than necessary. He's also  rude to students and full of himself. Every day before class we would all sit outside talking about how much we hate the class. Took up too much time and took away from classes that are actually meaningful. If you are taking his class, RUN AWAY!

The only cool thing about this class is NASCAR. His work he gives is dumb and everything is so complicated and hard when it shouldnt be. Honestly, I will probably fail this class, and do fine in all my other ones.

I loved his personality. However, his class was very irrevelant to what we were supposed to be learning. We barely touched the KSU foundations book. Also, he gives tedious assignments for little to no points earned.

This teacher is not very nice and is super boring. He makes you write papers that go against the normal way any human would write a paper. He makes you break them down in to sub sections. Like you have to have an heading for introduction conclusion & so on. Last time I checked I signed up for college not elementary school

This class was a waste of life! Plus the teacher is not good. He is self-absorbed and completely unorganized. He think is is helping his students when really all he is doing is boring them to tears because all he talks about is NASCAR. If you value your brain cells do not take this teacher. he thinkgs he is so cool but he is not Plus he can be rude
He's only interested in talking about himself, rather than acutally learning the material.Ksu 1101 is the most pointless class I've ever taken. Try to avoid if at all possible.

At first he seemed nice, then he got really full of himself. He's the prof and he knows it. Even if he's wrong he won't admit it. He's a very inconsistent grader. He takes off major points for something minor. He's not good with being clear and makes you try and read his mind. He won't answer your question. It'll be a riddle.
This is the most pointless class!! RUN AWAY! Do not take this, he is a bad teacher and gives too much work. It's all about NASCAR, it's the WORST!!

I did not learn anything from "Turbo." If you are considering taking his class, I would turn around and run. This freshman seminar took up all of my time and deducted from other more important classes. It didn't help me with my study skills, and all he talks about is NASCAR. He never helped me when I asked and always tried to make me feel dumb.

He's a really nice guy, but he'll make you work really hard for your grade. This course will definitely prepare you for harder courses. He has a strange way of grading papers, but if you follow his style you'll be fine. This is not an easy class, and if you slack off you will FAIL! Turbo's a funny guy, but this course is definitely hard!

He's way too difficult for the KSU 1101 level. At first glance he seems very organized, but later you discover he basically has no idea what he's doing. He relates the entire curriculum to NASCAR, which is absolutely laughable and makes no sense, and ruins the class for those like me who don't like NASCAR.

I have him for KSU 1101. This class is so hard, and so useless!! It is all about NASCAR and that is it. This is my hardest class, you have to write a ton of research papers, and go to speed ways and watch racing. He is a horrible teacher. DO NOT TAKE HIM!!

I do not like him as a person or professor. I have him for KSU1101 and he has no earthly idea what he is talking about; all he can do is talk about NASCAR and tries to relate anything and everything in his class to it. Its the only thing he knows and he is a sad excuse for a professor. I am halfway through the class and have no clue whats going on.

I had Professor Thompson Fall semester 2009 and I miss his class! He is very helpful and is really funny!Only thing is he is very picky about what he wants and sometimes that can mess people up if they don't pay attention.However,he is very clear so if you missed something thats your fault.The more help you ask for the better your grade will be!

Dr.Thompson aka Turbo, is my favorite professor I've had in the 2 years I've been at KSU. He is so passionate about public speaking and he is so helpful. He always made class interesting and even though his grading policy is rather intense, I came out of his class with a 98 due to hard work, practice & guidance from Turbo! He still checks up on me & a few of my classmates to make sure we're doing well in our studies & making the best of our college experience. HIGHLY RECOMMEND!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Nice and funny guy just grades pretty hard and his system is tough to learn, but you get it and he knows what he is talking about

Ok, so he's a cool guy, he DOES care about helping you and if you go to his office he will help you. I have worked my butt off, REALLY woKred hard. I havnt been slacking, and I STILL FAILED!! He teaches you a lot but is so picky and takes of 20 points for something little, only like 2 people arent failing. if you want a good grade, dont take him

Prof. Thompson is a great guy and really wants his students to succeed. If you are a person who has a fear of public speaking he can help you conquer your fear and give you the tools to succeed. One of the nicest profs I have had and is also funny at times. He does expect good work but if you do what he says that isn't a problem.

I absolutely recommend him, especially if you're a first-year student. You'll get a lot out of his class and become a much better speaker, unless you're a complete slacker and don't prepare. He cares about each student and is willing to help you whenever you need it. Really fun to talk to and personable - most of my learning community loves him.

If you didnt know how to speak in front of an audience, you will definitely be confident after her class is over. Some complained about his grading policies but as long as you look over her apa style when formulating a speech with a fine tooth comb and prepare you will do great. I got a high b in his class. Big on attendance but cares about student
He is very kind and helpful. He listens to what each student has to say. his assignments are sometimes odd, but he is fairly easy. I recommend him!
